00:00:04:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:04:080000.Dialogue: This movie baffles me every time we watch it.

00:00:08:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:08:100000.Dialogue: The instructions are very clear: "Don't feed the Gremlins after midnight."

00:00:26:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:26:120000.Dialogue: Yes. Since their relationship became carnal, Penny has upgraded his designated term of endearment, thus distinguishing him from those she calls "sweetie," usually in an attempt to soften a thinly-veiled insult.

00:00:42:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:42:080000.Dialogue: Although, sometimes, she omits the veil entirely.

00:00:45:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:45:210000.Dialogue: So, what are you guys doing?

00:00:49:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:49:070000.Dialogue: We're watching Goonies, Gremlins and Young Sherlock Holmes. They're all written by Chris Columbus.

00:00:56:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:56:160000.Dialogue: Okay. What do you watch on Thanksgiving?

00:01:02:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:02:220000.Dialogue: Oh, you know, that reminds me-- I usually go back to Nebraska for Thanksgiving, but this year they're calling it off on account of my brother's trial.

00:01:11:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:11:040000.Dialogue: Oh, just a big misunderstanding. You know, you'd actually li my brother. He's kind of a chemist.

00:01:19:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:19:140000.Dialogue: Anyway, I was thinking I'd have Thanksgiving here, and you are all invited.

00:01:23:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:23:220000.Dialogue: Will you be serving cranberry jelly or cranberry sauce?

00:01:28:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:28:020000.Dialogue: I guess I could serve both.

00:01:29:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:29:190000.Dialogue: You guess? You don't seem to have much of a handle on this.

00:01:35:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:35:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, I really wish I could, Penny, but every year, mother has all the relatives over and cooks up her famous tur-briska-fil.

00:01:44:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:44:140000.Dialogue: Turkey stuffed with a brisket stuffed with gefilte fish.

00:01:49:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:49:230000.Dialogue: It's not as good as it sounds.

00:01:54:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:54:160000.Dialogue: Oh, he usually comes to my house. Right, pal?

00:02:01:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:01:160000.Dialogue: All right, this year, you don't have to eat the tur-briska-fil.

00:02:06:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:06:170000.Dialogue: I don't even chew it. I swallow it like pills.

00:02:36:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:36:080000.Dialogue: So, what's going on with Raj?

00:02:38:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:38:020000.Dialogue: Well, the good news is, he has no problem with my mother's tur-briska-fil.

00:02:43:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:43:110000.Dialogue: Hard to believe, but go on.

00:02:46:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:46:020000.Dialogue: The bad news is, he says he'getting deported.

00:02:49:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:49:010000.Dialogue: Leonard: What do you mean, he's getting deported?

00:02:50:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:50:230000.Dialogue: I believe it means that the US Government is going to expel him from the country.

00:02:54:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:54:230000.Dialogue: He could then either return to his native India, emigrate to another country that's willing to accept him or wander the high seas as a stateless pirate.

00:03:08:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:08:220000.Dialogue: Penny, would you mind stepping outside so we can speak to him?

00:03:11:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:11:100000.Dialogue: (Groans) Fine. But the man really needs to work on his girl issues.

00:03:16:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:16:000000.Dialogue: Another reason to consider life of piracy. Even today, I understand that's an all-male profession.

00:03:35:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:35:090000.Dialogue: Okay, here's the deal: Six months ago, my research testing the predicted composition of trans-Neptunian objects ran into a dead end.

00:03:58:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:58:010000.Dialogue: So, wait, what have you been doing for the past six months?

00:04:03:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:03:150000.Dialogue: updating my Facebook status, messing up Wikipedia entries.

00:04:09:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:09:200000.Dialogue: Hey, did you know Netflix lets you stream movies on your computer now?

00:04:13:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:13:220000.Dialogue: And you've continued to take the universit's money under false pretenses? Highly unethical for an astrophysicist. Although pctically mandatory for a pirate.

00:04:24:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:24:170000.Dialogue: I don't want to go back to India. It's hot and loud, and there's so many people.

00:04:35:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:35:020000.Dialogue: Okay, guys, think. How do we keep Raj in the country?

00:04:43:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:43:060000.Dialogue: Penny: Why doesn't he just get another job?

00:04:51:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:51:220000.Dialogue: What are you asking me for?

00:04:53:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:53:050000.Dialogue: I don't know if you can talk now or not.

00:05:01:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:01:040000.Dialogue: Oh, beef... I'm going to miss you so much.

00:05:05:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:05:220000.Dialogue: Do you know, at the Mumbai McDonald's, You can't get a Big Mac? All you can get is a Chicken Maharaja Mac.

00:05:11:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:11:200000.Dialogue: And the special sauce-- curry-- which, in India, believe you me, iIs really not that special.

00:05:18:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:18:090000.Dialogue: Don't worry, you'll find another job.

00:05:20:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:20:090000.Dialogue: Yeah, let me start practicing for it. "Do you want fries with that Maharaja Mac?"

00:05:30:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:30:120000.Dialogue: Forgive me, as you know, I'm not adept at reading facial cues, but I'm going to take a stab here: You're either sad or nauseated.

00:05:40:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:40:020000.Dialogue: I was going to say sad. I don't know why I hedged.

00:05:45:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:45:140000.Dialogue: Elbow macaroni with ground hamburger and tomato sauce.

00:05:48:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:48:170000.Dialogue: Oh, beefaroni. I think I'll miss you most of all.

00:05:54:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:54:070000.Dialogue: I've always been a little confused about this. Why don't hindus eat beef?

00:05:58:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:58:230000.Dialogue: Not technically. In Hinduism, cattle are thought to be like god.

00:06:02:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:02:140000.Dialogue: Do not tell me about my own culture, Sheldon! In the mood I'm in, I'll take you out-- I swear to cow!

00:06:11:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:11:060000.Dialogue: Me, too. I'm st...I'm a little on edge.

00:06:13:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:13:230000.Dialogue: Understandable. Your entire life seems to be crumbling around you, and your future appears bleak at best.

00:06:21:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:21:120000.Dialogue: And you're wrong about Hinduism and cows.

00:06:24:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:24:160000.Dialogue: Hey, Raj, guess what. Professor Laughlin is looking for someone to join the stellar evolution research team.

00:06:40:070000.Speaker: Prof Laughlin
00:06:40:070000.Dialogue: Dr Koothrappali, come on in. I was surprised to here you were interested in joining our little team. Giving up on those trans-Neptunian objects, are we?

00:06:47:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:47:220000.Dialogue: No, no; it's a very promising area. In a perfect world I'd spend several more years on it. But I just couldn'pass up the opportunity to work with you on your tremendously exciting, and not yet conclusively disproved, hypothesis.

00:06:59:200000.Speaker: Prof Laughlin
00:06:59:200000.Dialogue: Splendid. Uh, please sit down. Can I offer you a sherry?

00:07:03:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:03:190000.Dialogue: It's a little early, isn't it?

00:07:08:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:08:100000.Dialogue: (Laughing): That's very good. Jolly amusing, but if you don't mind, I'll hold off until sunset on Titan.

00:07:15:060000.Speaker: Prof Laughlin
00:07:15:060000.Dialogue: (Laughs) Well done. I have a feeling you're going to fit in just fine, Dr Koothrappali.

00:07:24:020000.Speaker: Prof Laughlin
00:07:24:020000.Dialogue: No, no, no. Right on time. Dr Koothrappali, may I present Dr Millstone from MIT. She'll be heading up our data analysis team.

00:07:31:030000.Speaker: Dr Millstone
00:07:31:030000.Dialogue: It's nice to meet you, Dr Koothrappali.

00:07:34:130000.Speaker: Dr Millstone
00:07:34:130000.Dialogue: I read your paper on Kuiper Belt object size distribution. I really enjoyed it.

00:07:43:150000.Speaker: Dr Millstone
00:07:43:150000.Dialogue: How did you correct for the selection bias?

00:07:46:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:46:010000.Dialogue: Well, I ran a simulation that allowed me to correct for the observational efficiency.

00:07:54:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:54:060000.Dialogue: Thank you. Would you like to hear more about it in my hot tub?

00:08:09:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:09:210000.Dialogue: What do you mean you didn't get the job? How could you not get it?

00:08:13:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:13:090000.Dialogue: You know... he's British; I'm Indian. Ever since Gandhi, they haven't liked us very much.

00:08:21:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:21:070000.Dialogue: Wait, are you saying that he discriminated against you? Because we should file a complaint.

00:08:25:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:25:040000.Dialogue: That's okay. A complaint has been filed.

00:08:30:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:30:050000.Dialogue: So, that's it. That was my last hope. I'm going to be deported, sent home in disgrace, exposed to the sardonic barb of my cousin Sanjay. Or, as you may know him, Dave from AT & T Customer Service.

00:08:48:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:48:230000.Dialogue: I'm really going to miss you.

00:08:49:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:49:230000.Dialogue: Will you come visit me in India?

00:08:55:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:55:230000.Dialogue: How about I meet you halfway?

00:08:57:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:57:130000.Dialogue: Halfway is 600 miles off the coast of Japan.

00:09:24:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:24:080000.Dialogue: Odd. Usually, he's met by cheers.

00:09:27:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:27:210000.Dialogue: Anyway, I was thinking about exploring the string theory implications of gamma rays from dark matter annihilations, and it occurred to me that I could benefit--

00:09:35:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:35:100000.Dialogue: Excuse me, Sheldon. How many reels before the subordinate male protagonist gets to his point?

00:09:39:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:39:160000.Dialogue: I'm sorry-- if you didn't cheer at my entrance, it's too late to buy into the premise.

00:09:46:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:46:050000.Dialogue: Anyway, I got some extra money from the head of the department, and Raj can come work for me.

00:09:53:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:53:030000.Dialogue: You want me to work with you?

00:09:57:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:57:040000.Dialogue: You're going to have to listen more carefully when you're on the job.

00:10:01:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:01:020000.Dialogue: Ay, uh, please don't take this the wrong way, but I'd rather swim buck-naked across the Ganges with a paper cut on my nipple

00:10:08:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:08:190000.Dialogue: and die a slow, agonizing death from a viral infection, than work with you.

00:10:49:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:49:110000.Dialogue: I've reconsidered your offer to let me work with you.

00:10:54:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:54:230000.Dialogue: Yes, for you. I do, however, have a few conditions. First, at all times, I am to be treated as a colleague and an equal. Second, my contributions shall be noted in all published material. And third, you are never allowed to lecture me on Hinduism or my Indian culture.

00:11:11:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:11:130000.Dialogue: I'm impressed, Raj. Those are very cogent and reasonable conditions.

00:11:19:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:19:050000.Dialogue: Then you leave me no choice. I accept the job.

00:11:24:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:24:010000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I believe you've misunderstood. I'm not giving you the job. I'm simply affording you the opportunity to apply for it.

00:11:33:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:33:220000.Dialogue: Have a seat; we'll get started with the interview.

00:11:49:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:49:010000.Dialogue: that's what you wear to an interview?

00:11:53:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:53:050000.Dialogue: Come on, dude, we've been friends for years.

00:11:58:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:58:220000.Dialogue: Sheldon, for God's sakes, don't make me beg.

00:12:04:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:04:200000.Dialogue: You've fallen victim to another one of my classic practical jokes.

00:12:10:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:10:200000.Dialogue: I'm your boss now. You may want to laugh at that.

00:12:17:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:17:160000.Dialogue: Ah, nice having the place to ourselves, isn't it?

00:12:20:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:20:210000.Dialogue: Uh-huh. Now that Raj is working for Sheldon, I don't have to chauffeur him around anymore. Plus, yeah, with them working late so much, we get some privacy.

00:12:28:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:28:170000.Dialogue: Mm-hmm. Hey, want to get a little crazy?

00:12:36:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:36:110000.Dialogue: Let's slide over to Sheldon's spot a make out.

00:12:47:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:47:220000.Dialogue: Oh, God, how did he know?

00:13:07:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:07:230000.Dialogue: Tonight's the night I usually go line dancing with Raj at the Palomino.

00:13:23:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:23:150000.Dialogue: Okay, I guess I can hang for a little while.

00:13:27:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:27:130000.Dialogue: So what are we watching? Sex and the City. Yikes.

00:13:32:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:32:010000.Dialogue: Hey, I happen to love this movie.

00:13:34:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:34:210000.Dialogue: Fine, let's watch it. Maybe all our periods will synchronize.

00:13:44:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:44:070000.Dialogue: All right, we're going to be designing an experiment to look for the nihilation spectrum resulting from dark matter collisions in space.

00:13:51:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:51:050000.Dialogue: Ooh, dark matter. We better bring a flashlight.

00:13:59:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:59:000000.Dialogue: I'm the boss. I make the jokes.

00:14:03:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:03:150000.Dialogue: Sorry go ahead and make your joke.

00:14:05:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:05:100000.Dialogue: This is not the time for joking.

00:14:08:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:08:110000.Dialogue: We're doing serious research, Which requires complete and utter focus.

00:14:11:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:11:180000.Dialogue: All right, let's buckle down and work.

00:15:06:180000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:06:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:09:180000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:09:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:09:180000.Dialogue: Leonard, honey, you don't have to say thank you every time we have sex.

00:15:13:010000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:13:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:15:080000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:15:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:15:080000.Dialogue: Tomorrow you're going to get a card in the mail. Just throw it away.

00:15:22:060000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:22:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:22:060000.Dialogue: (In Irish brogue): Top o' the mornin' to ya!

00:15:27:040000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:27:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:28:200000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:28:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:28:200000.Dialogue: Well, usually, on Sundays, I go with Raj to scam on hippie chicks at the farmer's market,

00:15:33:180000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:33:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:33:180000.Dialogue: but he's still working with Sheldon, so I thought I'd come over here and make you guys scrambled eggs and salami.

00:15:40:120000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:40:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:40:120000.Dialogue: It's the perfect meal for apres l'amour.

00:15:45:210000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:45:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:48:100000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:48:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:48:100000.Dialogue: By the way, I couldn't help overhearing your big finish. Bravo, Leonard.

00:15:56:020000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:15:56:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:56:020000.Dialogue: See, if you had killed me when I said "kill me," I wouldn't have had to hear that. (Stammers)

00:16:00:080000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:00:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:00:080000.Dialogue: What do you guys think? Want to take in a matinee, maybe go rollerblading, catch a step class?

00:16:06:060000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:06:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:07:220000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:07:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:07:220000.Dialogue: Okay. Um, Howard, we need to talk.

00:16:11:110000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:11:110000.Speaker: Howard

00:16:14:110000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:14:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:14:110000.Dialogue: Uh... please understand that it's not that we don't want you around, but Penny and I occasionally need some... alone time.

00:16:25:050000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:25:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:25:050000.Dialogue: Oh. I-I get it, I'm the third wheel. Sorry, I should have seen that. I'll get out of your way. Uh, you're gonna want to eat those eggs while they're still hot.

00:16:39:180000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:39:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:39:180000.Dialogue: Thank you. There's lochs and cream cheese in the fridge. The bagels are in the oven.

00:16:50:020000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:50:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:52:230000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:52:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:52:230000.Dialogue: I'm just going to hang out with my mom that's always fun

00:16:58:030000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:16:58:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:06:130000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:17:06:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:08:020000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:17:08:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:08:020000.Dialogue: I don't know. What do you want me to do?

00:17:12:100000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:17:12:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:14:090000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:17:14:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:16:020000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:17:16:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:20:020000.Scene: Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
00:17:20:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:20:020000.Dialogue: Oh, you guys had me scared for a minute.

00:17:25:230000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:25:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:25:230000.Dialogue: No, no, no, no! That rate is much too low from what we'd expect from this collision. Do you understand we're talking about dark matter colliding in outer space?

00:17:33:120000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:33:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:33:120000.Dialogue: Of course I understand. And who are you to tell me about outer space?

00:17:37:020000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:37:020000.Speaker: Raj

00:17:41:060000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:41:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:43:230000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:43:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:43:230000.Dialogue: Okay, well, let me just tell you, if we we having this argument in my native language, I'd be kicking your butt.

00:17:50:080000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:50:080000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:51:000000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.

00:17:54:130000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:54:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:54:130000.Dialogue: Okay, you got me there, but you're wrong about this!

00:17:57:190000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:17:57:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:57:190000.Dialogue: There is a fine line between wrong and visionary. Unfortunately you have to be a visionary to see it.

00:18:03:190000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:03:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:03:190000.Dialogue: My God, you think that every thought that comes out of your head is pure gold. Well, let me tell you something. Some of those thoughts are pure caca.

00:18:10:190000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:10:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:12:150000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:12:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:18:13:180000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:13:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:15:150000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:15:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:15:150000.Dialogue: First of all, Dr Koothrappali, when I first proposed that you work with me..

00:18:18:210000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:18:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:18:210000.Dialogue: Aha! So I am working with you.

00:18:20:200000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:20:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:20:200000.Dialogue: In this context, "with me" means "for me."

00:18:24:000000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:24:000000.Speaker: Raj

00:18:25:050000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:25:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:28:050000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:30:010000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:30:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:30:010000.Dialogue: Okay. Here's where we derive the mass of the dark matter particle.

00:18:35:140000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:35:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:35:140000.Dialogue: You've mis-stated the atomic weight of the target.

00:18:37:040000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:37:040000.Speaker: Raj

00:18:38:150000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:38:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:38:150000.Dialogue: I'm not defacing it, I'm fixing it.

00:18:40:100000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:40:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:42:030000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:42:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:42:030000.Dialogue: I said give it to me.

00:18:43:160000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:43:160000.Speaker: Raj

00:18:46:180000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:46:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:55:000000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:55:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:55:000000.Dialogue: Dr Koothrappali, as your superior, I forbid you from writing on my board!

00:18:58:220000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:18:58:220000.Speaker: Raj

00:19:00:100000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:19:00:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:01:200000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:19:01:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:01:200000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah? Can you do this?

00:19:03:000000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.

00:19:09:010000.Scene: Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
00:19:09:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:09:010000.Dialogue: Nice working with you. I'm sorry-- for you.

00:19:48:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:48:040000.Dialogue: All right, you've made your point.

00:19:50:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:50:200000.Dialogue: I looked overr the board and it turns out you were right.

00:20:00:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:00:060000.Dialogue: Anyway, I would like you to come back and work for me.

00:20:06:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:06:040000.Dialogue: In this context "for me" could mean "with me."

00:20:09:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:09:170000.Dialogue: All right, but I have some conditions.

00:20:15:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:15:140000.Dialogue: Wait, you have to drive me home.

00:20:27:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:27:210000.Dialogue: On the way home, we can start thinking about methods of optimizing the detector for 500 gev particles.
